pr_title: Removing the hardcoded system apps names in the logout handler and retrieve from system apps db table

timeline.bodyText: Can't we remove this new line and keep as a single line?
timeline.author: menakaj

replies.bodyText:
Also add a space before "doesn't"
"The tenant: " + tenantDomain + " doesn't have any system apps"
replies.author: menakaj

timeline.bodyText:
Remove the concatenation and keep in a single line.
    `public static final String GET__APPLICATIONS = "SELECT * FROM AM_SYSTEM_APPS WHERE TENANT_DOMAIN = ?";`
timeline.author: menakaj

replies.bodyText: Ther are two _ characters in the variable.
replies.author: menakaj

timeline.author: malinthaprasan

timeline.bodyText: Can we continue when error happens?
timeline.author: malinthaprasan

replies.bodyText:
Yes, then there won't be any tokens related to system apps will be revoked and will log that above error message, but will terminate the user session from IDP side and user will be logged out of the client.
Therefore, if there is an issue in database connections, it will not affect the logout flow. The downside is, then the tokens related to that user also won't get revoked.
